thread.title: Police looking for 'soccer mom' shoplifter who walked out of store wearing expensive boots
thread.title_full: Police looking for 'soccer mom' shoplifter who walked out of store wearing expensive boots | OregonLive.com

author: Rick Bella | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Police looking for 'soccer mom' shoplifter who walked out of store wearing expensive boots
text:
Oregon City police are asking for the public's help in identifying a woman who stole a pair of high-end boots last week from a farm-supply store.
Sgt. Matthew Paschall, Oregon City Police Department spokesman, said a woman entered the Wilco Farm Store , located at 19224 Molalla Ave ., around 8:30 a.m. Friday and tried on a pair of Bogs -brand boots. The store's surveillance video shows the woman trying on the boots, then putting her own shoes into her purse. She then left the store, wearing the boots.
"It's very odd," Paschall said. "She doesn't look much like the typical shoplifter. She looks more like a soccer mom â€“ or a soccer grandma, even."
Paschall said the surveillance videos captured images of the woman leaving the store with the boots and also show her leaving he parking lot in a newer, tan-colored SUV.
The woman is described as having shoulder-length blonde hair and wearing glasses.
Paschall urged anyone with information on the woman, the incident or her vehicle to call the Oregon City Police Department's tip line at 503-496-1616.
-- Rick Bella rbella@oregonian.com
503-294-5915; @southnewshound
